meanings.definition: A woman who is considered to be sexually promiscuous or immoral.
meanings.sent1: The town gossips whispered about the floosies who moved in next door.
meanings.sent2: The tabloids were filled with stories about Hollywood floosies.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, Sarah jokingly dressed up as a floosie from the 1920s.
meanings.sent4: The old western movie portrayed the saloon as a den of floosies and outlaws.
meanings.sent5: In the detective novel, the femme fatale turned out to be a cunning floosie with a hidden agenda.

meanings.sent1: The group of floosies giggled and chatted at the cafe.
meanings.sent2: The floosies in the bar caught the attention of the patrons.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actors comically portrayed a troupe of floosies causing chaos in the town.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with colorful flowers, resembling a garden of floosies in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibit showcased a collection of paintings depicting elegant floosies from different eras.
